DOC.brief_summary: The aim pilot study determine whether technology-enhanced version establish behavioral treatment protocol , Helping Noncompliant Child ( HNC ; McMahon & Forehand ) , enhance engagement treatment outcome low income parent 3 8 child externalize problem treatment . It predict family HNC technology-enhanced HNC ( TE-HNC ) program evidence significant improvement parent behavior child externalize problem ; however , predict parent-child dyad TE-HNC program require few session , likely retain program , likely remain engaged program ( e.g. , practice skill session etc . ) , likely active involvement coparenting partner ( i.e. , adult family member participate childrearing ) .In turn , expect TE-HNC program boost treatment outcome .
